intro: Curcuma nankunshanensis, commonly known as the Nankunshan ginger, is a rare and endemic species native to China. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers and turmeric. The plant is characterized by its robust rhizomes, which are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Its leaves are broad and lance-shaped, while its flowers are typically yellow or orange in color. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable but vulnerable species in botanical conservation efforts.
